result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek D Merriweather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Derek D Merriweather in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was prepared to enter a plea but has to get to work.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Zoe Everett in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case passed until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Derek D Merriweather in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derek D Merriweather in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment of the pretrial conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 21.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Derek D Merriweather in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Derek D Merriweather in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
